intro: Cowiea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine cowiea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its tubular, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
